[Document(page_content='Page 1 of 8
Agenda Item # 4.A.
Public Works Commission 
Agenda Report
To: Chair Simmens and Members of the Public Works Commission
Prepared by: Troy Spayd, Assistant Public Works Director/City Engineer
Approved by: Rob DuBoux, Public Works Director/City Engineer
Date prepared: October 21, 2021 Meeting date: October 27, 2021
Subject: Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects Status 
Report
RECOMMENDED ACTION: Receive and file report on the status of the City’s current and 
upcoming Capital Improvements Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects.
DISCUSSION: Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the 
Fiscal Year 2021-2022 Capital Improvement Program:
Capital Improvement Projects (Design)
Marie Canyon Green Streets
¾ Updates:
\x83 A hydrology report was prepared and will be used to size the pre\x02manufactured biofilters. City staff is reviewing multiple biofilter 
manufacturers for filters that will work in the proposed project area. It is 
anticipated to have a final design by March 2022. The project will be 
advertised for construction bids shortly after this date. 
¾ Project Schedule: 
\x83 Complete Design: March 2022
\x83 Begin Construction: Spring 2022
PCH Median Improvements Project
¾ Updates:
\x83 The project was approved by the Planning Commission on September 
8, 2021. This project requires Caltrans approval since the work will be 
on Pacific Coast Highway. The project reports and plans are being 
routed through Caltrans for final approval. It is anticipated that the 
project will have final approval by March 2022. The project will be 
Public Works
Commission Meeting
10-27-21
Item
4.A.', metadata={'chunk_index': 0.0, 'page': 0.0, 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__01262022-1835.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0}), Document(page_content='Page 7 of 8
Agenda Item # 4.A.
¾ Updates:
\x83 This project is currently under design with the City’s consultant. It is 
anticipated that the final design will be complete by February 2022. The 
project will be advertised for construction bids with construction 
beginning in April 2022.
¾ Estimated Schedule:
\x83 Complete Design: February 2022
\x83 Begin Construction: April 2022
Encinal Canyon Road Drainage Improvements (CalOES Project)
¾ Project Description: This project consists of repairing damage storm drain 
facilities and roadway embankments that were damaged by the Woolsey Fire.
¾ Updates:
\x83 The project design will commence during the Spring 2022.
¾ Estimated Schedule: TBD
Malibu Road Slope Repairs (CalOES Project)
¾ Project Description: The existing slope adjacent to the beach access stairs 
at 24712 Malibu Road has been eroded and caused damage to Malibu Road.
¾ Updates:
\x83 The City has hired a consultant to design this project. The design has 
started and is anticipated to be completed by the Spring of 2022.
¾ Estimated Schedule:
\x83 Complete Design: Spring 2022
\x83 Begin Construction: Fall 2022
Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs (CalOES Project)
¾ Project Description: The project consists of repairs the damaged shoulder on 
Westward Beach Road.
¾ Upates:
\x83 This project is currently under design with the City’s consultant. It is 
anticipated that the final design will be complete by July 2022. The 
project will be advertised for construction bids with construction 
beginning in Fall 2022. 
¾ Estimated Schedule:
\x83 Complete Design: July 2022
\x83 Begin Construction: Fall 2022
\x83
Outdoor Warningn Sirens - Design (FEMA Project)
¾ Project Description: An Emergency Warning Siren system will improve the 
City’s ability to alert the community by providing mechanisms to alert 
residents in areas without power and those who live in neighborhoods with 
poor cell service. Phase One of the project included a sound study to', metadata={'chunk_index': 9.0, 'page': 6.0, 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__01262022-1835.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0}), Document(page_content='Page 8 of 8
Agenda Item # 4.A.
awarded a FEMA Hazard Mitigation grant to fund the design, engineering and 
environmental compliance needed for a shovel ready project. Phase Two of 
the Emergency Warning Sirens project will be implementation of the design 
plan, including purchasing, installing, and testing the sirens. The City will 
apply for future grant funding for this phase of the project.
¾ Upates:
\x83 On November 30, 2021, City Council approved an agreement with 
Acoustic Technology to design the outdoor warning sirens. A design 
report will be presented to Council upon completion.
¾ Estimated Schedule: TBD
Disaster Projects (Construction)
None at this time
Disaster Projects (Completed)
Citywide Guardrail Replacement
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout 
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and 
Kanan Dume Road. The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged 
guardrails. The project was completed in February 2021.
Malibu Park Storm Drain Repairs
Project Description: After the Woolsey Fire, subsequent storms caused damage to 
multiple storm drain facilities throughout Malibu. The project repaired the storm drains on 
Cuthbert Road, Morning View Drive, Busch Drive at Harvester Road. The project also 
included the repair of a storm drainage facility on Birdview Avenue.', metadata={'chunk_index': 11.0, 'page': 7.0, 'source': 'data/civic/raw_data/malibucity_agenda__01262022-1835.pdf', 'start_index': 0.0})]

out_data:
The projects related to disaster with a start date later than 2021 are: 
1. Marie Canyon Green Streets
2. PCH Median Improvements Project
3. Encinal Canyon Road Drainage Improvements (CalOES Project)
4. Malibu Road Slope Repairs (CalOES Project)
5. Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs (CalOES Project)
6. Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design (FEMA Project)
